text: INTRODUCTION
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: The Starman Team dedicated its first book, Assault On Mars, to Joseph
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Greene, the late author of the Dig Allen series which was the
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: inspiration for the Starman series. A complimentary copy was sent to
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: his son Paul, who was moved by the tribute. We then asked Paul to write
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: an introduction to The Runaway Asteroid. The following is his
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: response-surely one of the most unusual introductions in any book
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: anywhere, and one we are privileged to share with our readers.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Dear Dad,
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: A most remarkable invention is weaving the world together in a way we
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: never anticipated while you were on Earth, and it netted your writing.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Fans of your books for juveniles, The Digby Allen series, were able to
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: connect to each other, share their enthusiasm for your novels, and were
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: inspired to continue the voyage. Led by Jonathan Cooper, the intrepid
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: mastermind of the creative crew, they made a commitment to write their
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: own vision of the future. Thoughtfully, they credit you as having
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: shoulders broad enough for them to stand on and see the centuries
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: beyond. The invention that has made this possible is called the
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: internet. There seems no need to explain what it is here, but part of
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: its magic is that it can permit people to connect to each other
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: independently of time and space.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: The themes of Dig Allen from the 1960's have worked like the internet
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: in that they functioned independently of time and space, only much more
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: slowly. You presented your ideas in books as ideas are posted on the
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: internet. The authors of Starman were drawn to the themes in your books
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: and then each other in cyberspace, which acts as both the bookshelf and
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: caf<U+008E> for today's ideas and authors. The creators of Starman saw value
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: in your stories and tried to get the publisher to renew the series.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Sadly, your old publisher ignored them and blocked the revival, as
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: though they were so much space junk.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: No one owns a theme. But the creators of Starman have shown that they
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: share some of the beliefs that you express in your subjects. Their
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: young men of the stars prove that they too are brave, adventurous and
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: willing to sacrifice for freedom and justice.  With a loyalty toward
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: each other that would create envy in every generation, they test
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: themselves against cunning scoundrels. As they conquer villains, they,
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: and we along with them, learn whether they measure up. Will they prove
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: themselves worthy as young people have done for all time? Young readers
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: can have a chance to preview something about their own lives and the
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: world they will live in. And just as you believed, somehow the human
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: race survives. If the world of Starman is an accurate guess on the
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: future, then the good guys, the ones in the white spacesuits, will
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: continue to prevail and produce more young people to keep the dream
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: alive. I hope that some of the next generation of courageous young
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: people will read this series.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Your fans don't know that you started writing seriously relatively
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: early in life, in the 1920's and '30's, first as a teen for your
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: personal pleasure and then on your school newspaper at New Utrecht High
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: School in Brooklyn, New York. Did having to learn the English language
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: after speaking Russian until the age of seven help you become a better
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: writer? Were your poems and letters to Mom valuable both to her and to
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: your professional development? Did the comic books you authored during
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: the Golden Age of comics give you a better sense of story-telling and
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: dialogue or did it degrade your love of language? I know that writing
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: television scripts and other creative projects supported the family
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: during the difficult years of the 1950's, but how did it affect your
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: later work with Digby Allen? So many of your themes are repeated and
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: reworked in several of your creations right through to the late 1980's.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Who would guess that you once wrote a paper on the use of the raven in
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: several of Shakespeare's plays? Or that you wrote biology text to
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: accompany a new medium, slides made from strips of 35-mm film? Would
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: admirers realize that you were most interested in world events, but
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: read the sports section of the New York Times first, everyday? I'm
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: certain your fans wouldn't have read the American Elsewhen Almanac, a
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: compilation of bits of Americana and commentary that you published in
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: the 1980's.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: I want to thank the authors of Starman for giving me the opportunity to
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: write the introduction to their second novel. If there is a way to
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: communicate to you across the veil between our dimensional world and
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: the one in which you now reside, then it must be through the pages of a
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: book. After the love of family, I don't believe anything was more
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: precious to you than books, so maybe this letter will be able to cross
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: the divide. Just as I proofread the drafts of Digby Allen before you
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: sent them to the publisher, your granddaughter and grandson proofread
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: this. Perhaps that will act like a mystical booster rocket to get these
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: pages to you.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: And to future space pioneers, may the solar winds be at your back.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Love,
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Paul
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: October 20, 2000
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: THE RUNAWAY ASTEROID
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: 1: Controlled Fury
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: "THEY'RE getting closer! They're almost on us! We won't make it into
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: the Belt on time!" The navigator of the Silver Spear was on the verge
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: of panic. His frenzied hands moved over the controls.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: "Keep going! Keep up full speed! Make sure that we get there ahead of
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: them!" Lurton Zimbardo's voice was even and controlled, but it was
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: obvious that he was barely containing his volatile fury. His commands
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: were not to be questioned. His nostrils flared, the muscles around his
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: lips were taut, he kept his fists clenched and pounded a persistent
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: rhythm on his ship's control panel. His breath sounded as if he could
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: inhale and exhale the room's entire atmosphere. It was only his iron
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: self-control that kept his crew from giving in to their fears.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Behind them just moments away Starman David "Zip" Foster's ship, the
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Star Ranger, was closing the gap. The pursuit had been going on for two
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: days, since the Silver Spear had blasted off from Eagle City on Mars
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: and escaped while the rest of the pirates were rounded up by Earth's
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: forces. Zip Foster, accompanied by Starmen Mark Seaton and Joe Taylor
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: and their companion Steve Cliff, had followed less than fifteen minutes
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: later. The brief lead that Lurton Zimbardo's ship had was enough to
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: keep the Silver Spear out of the clutches of their pursuers, but not by
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: much. The crew of the Spear was suffering acutely from sleeplessness
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: and mounting anxiety.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Only days earlier, Lurton Zimbardo had been second-in-command under
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Troy Putnam. Together they had organized over 500 men and attempted to
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: take control of the capital city of Mars in a sudden attack. Had they
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: succeeded, the pirates could have held the people of the Earth-Moon
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: system hostage to their demands. The Starmen and their allies had
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: thwarted the pirates' plan. Most of the pirates, including their
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: leader, had been captured. Zimbardo, however, had escaped with a few
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: others. With the Starmen in close pursuit, he was desperately trying to
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: outrun them and return to the pirates' base in the Asteroid Belt.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: The Belt loomed up. The first few chunks of rock were visible now to
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: the unaided eyes of those on the deck of the Silver Spear. In seconds,
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: they were among them. The navigator screamed as the ship whipped by a
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: pitted rock a quarter of a mile long, missing it by a few yards.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: "Fool!" shouted Zimbardo. "Turn on the automatic pilot!" The
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: navigator's eyes were the size of saucers. Immobile with terror, he
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: didn't respond to Zimbardo's command. The former second-in-command of
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: the pirates pushed him out of the chair, took over, and activated the
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: switch that cut in the automatic pilot. Lurton Zimbardo was not
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: physically imposing, but more than made up for his slight build with an
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: immensely strong will and a decisive nature that was merciless whenever
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: it served him.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: He knew they were going too fast even for the automatic pilot to keep
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: the ship safe once they entered the thick sweep of the asteroids. He
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: also knew that the Belt was their only hope of escaping the Starmen on
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: their trail. Powered by adrenaline, his senses were functioning at
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: their peak. With amazing alacrity and intensity, Zimbardo aided the
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: automatic pilot and threaded the Silver Spear through the weaving
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: asteroids. It almost seemed as if he were in a trance.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Soon a dark asteroid loomed ahead, roughly shaped like a potato,
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: forty-five miles long and twenty-five wide, rotating slowly around its
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: longest axis. It was nearly invisible both to the eye and to the
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: instruments, but Zimbardo knew where it was. He barked out a command.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: The Silver Spear slowed quickly, and moments later a huge airlock door
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: opened in one of the poles of the asteroid. Zimbardo piloted the ship
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: into the airlock, through the stone tunnel that led into the interior
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: of the asteroid, and then touched down.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: The thin, wiry man raced for the control room as fast as he could run,
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: pushing men out of the way and heeding no one who called out to him.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Once inside, he quickly pressed a series of buttons and entered a
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: numeric code. Once it was entered and confirmed, he made a fist and
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: slammed it hard on a large red button. Immediately all the radar
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: screens were covered with snow.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Zimbardo relaxed for the first time in days. He exhaled quietly and
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: actually smiled. He took a deep breath and smiled more broadly.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: "Sir?" asked one of the technicians who had watched the procedure.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: "I detonated a hydrogen bomb on a neighboring asteroid a couple of
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: hundred miles from here. Part of a backup plan for keeping this place
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: hidden. It will clog all radar screens for a few minutes. By the time
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: they clear, no one will be able to find us or this asteroid."
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Zimbardo's relaxed state did not last long. He swelled up with energy
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: again, strode to another console, and tapped in a series of commands.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: "Come here, Gene," he ordered as his fingers flew over the keyboard.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: The man he addressed quickly came to stand by the pirate leader. He was
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: a well-built young man in his late twenties with short curly brown
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: hair, finely chiseled features, and an obvious desire to please. He was
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: well trained in the technology of space control systems. After he had
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: proven his competence in the field, Troy Putnam had made him his chief
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: control officer.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Zimbardo continued. "Follow these coordinates at this speed. Don't
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: alter the course for any reason without my permission."
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Gene looked at the planning board where the numbers were posted in a
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: pleasant green light. "That course will take us out of the Belt, Mr.
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: Zimbardo. Is that what you want?"
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: "That's what I want. It's time to move away from here. If anything out
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: of the ordinary happens, let me know immediately. Find me by using my
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: personal code on the communicator-no general announcement. Keep watch

author: Cooper, Michael D.

author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: of the rest."

text: site, he can't find us now or show anyone else how to find us."
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: "He can't find us, but he knows how this asteroid works-almost as well

author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: as I do. If the Starmen learn what he knows, it could be disastrous for
title: The Runaway Asteroid

text: us in the unlikely chance that they ever locate us. I don't like taking
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid

text: end we can't afford."

author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid

text: calls home."

author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: "Our men have quietly inquired for him on Ceres and learned that he has

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

text: been large, easy-going, and confident, Zimbardo's was tight,
title: The Runaway Asteroid

text: highly-organized, and ruthless. Its high degree of efficiency was
title: The Runaway Asteroid

text: had rapidly become an extension of his formidable personality.

author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: He took an elevator from his suite down to the main floor of the
title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

text: the crew yesterday. We should be finished by tomorrow afternoon."
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: "Good. And the power units?"
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: workers assembling these. The same with the propulsion units. They

text: won't be ready for at least a week, not even one of them. However, once

text: we get the prototype finished the rest should follow rapidly."
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: "How long until you have all 85 completed?"
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: "I should have a good number of the unskilled workers ready for a new
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: assignment once they have finished with the sheathing plates. Once the
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: design has been checked by the experts, we can get them cracking on the
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: power and propulsion units. Of course, each unit will have to be tested
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: by the experts, so I would estimate that all 85 can be operational

text: within ten days-unless we run into any problems."
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid

text: Ceres was the hub of the Asteroid Belt. Nearly 600 miles across, it was
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: turned in a large swath between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter. It was
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: the place where professional miners first arrived from Earth before
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: their companies farmed them out to the mining centers on various
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: asteroids. Independent asteroid miners came to Ceres once in a while
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

text: for supplies, and corporations picked up equipment imported daily from
title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid

author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid

text: around a hive.

author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid
author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid

author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

text: room.

text: their visit.

author: Cooper, Michael D.

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

title: The Runaway Asteroid

text: planet. Over 4,000 miles in diameter, it was everywhere foreboding,

text: themselves were depressed at the sight.

title: The Runaway Asteroid
